{"step_by_step_thinking": "The coronal suture is the fibrous joint that separates the frontal and parietal bones of the skull. If it fuses too early, a condition known as craniosynostosis, it can affect the shape of the head because the skull can't expand perpendicular to the suture. This results in a short, wide head, a condition known as brachycephaly.", "answer_choice": "A"}
